About

  • Vincent Piotrowski
  • Reading List

Photos

All that we are is the result of what we have thought and experienced. I'm grateful for being able to spend time outdoors in nature.

Canadian Rockies

Photos of mountains, lakes, and waterfalls taken from the national and provincial parks of Western Canada. This particular gallery is rife with scenery that fits the archetypal postcard image and embodies the rugged outdoors lifestyle.
View gallery

Alberta Foothills

Where the Rocky Mountains meet the boreal forest and where I call home. With its abundant wildlife and plant life this is a place where all of us can connect with the natural world.
View gallery

Alberta Badlands

One of my favorite areas to shoot because it feels otherworldly. The Alberta Badlands are filled with desert scenery, venomous creatures, and dinosaur bones.
View gallery

Alberta Prairies

Delapidated fences, barns, and fields are featured in this gallery. Themes of farming and agriculture are almost unavoidable when photographing the Alberta Prairies because of their effect on the landscape.
View gallery

Travel

The Pacific Northwest is home to incredible scenery like rolling hills, prehistoric coastal forests, and the continuation of the Rocky Mountains. Many of the photographers that inspire me live in this area.
View gallery
